conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: But one more note on a change we're rolling out within Secure, pretty lightweight, in that we're establishing a second team within dynamic analysis.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: And so, issue is there if folks want to play – that would like to follow along or ask any questions about it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.text: The differentiation – I think the difference between what's happening in Threat Insights and within Dynamic Analysis is that this is a split along feature category, even though we're keeping – we're not spreading a new group.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: I don't know if it's a big rock, but it kind of belongs here perhaps more than other places.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: So I did that survey where we got an awesome response rate from the team on how to improve the MR rate for the team.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: And then I took a really long time to go through all the results and summarize and make

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: initial recommendations.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: I got caught up in other things like cross-functional prioritization and the customer escalation.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: So since then, this is actually used by John Hope to lead a discussion at the development off-site last week on just improving engineering velocity as one of the things he used to power it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: So it had value there.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: But I've seen no comments, I think, from anybody in this group, which means either no time, forgot about it, or it doesn't

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: We looked at it, and it doesn't have much value.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: And any of those things are OK.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: I'm just curious where the group landed.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: And if you haven't taken a look yet to see if there's anything you want to take away from it on things you might want to consider, I'm asking you to do so.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: And to consider, not to do, but to consider.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: Anybody gotten a chance to read it yet and think about it or not just yet?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: My guess is perhaps everybody's really busy and they haven't looked yet.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: Yeah, I'm hoping that MR-RAID is kind of an artifact or a byproduct of some other actions.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: The big thing we're doing is more whole type of work, like random, miscellaneous, not scheduled, not PM necessarily, actions or issues.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: And that actually is creating some more additional work.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: Like it's just like free time work.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: I want to change the pace, move to something else momentarily.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: And these are generally smaller types of issues too, so they're quicker to knock out.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: Therefore they create more MRs, which has been a cool byproduct.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 02
conversation.text: So I think that's helping us succeed there.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 00
conversation.text: Yeah, we're also seeing some success with, uh, we've implemented like a weekly refinement meeting to kind of check in, make sure that, uh, stories are broken down tiny enough.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 00
conversation.text: I think with smaller bits of work, we're seeing a higher MR rate.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 00
conversation.text: Um, it's debatable whether or not that's like just inflated, right?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 00
conversation.text: Like you can work on a small piece of code and ship it and you can do that a lot of times you're going to get a higher MR rate.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 00
conversation.text: We're trying to be reasonable with that.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 00
conversation.text: I am noticing a nice tick up after implementing the refinement meeting, so let's hope for the best.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: All right, FedRAMP and the can't or won't fix security issues that we may be having.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: So we've got them for security issues that are subject to FedRAMP.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: If you have a feature category that is FIPS compliant or certified, you're probably going to be part of the FedRAMP evaluation.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: And any security issue that has a CVE associated with it, which means dependency or container scanning specifically,

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: has to have a remediation plan, even if they're false positives.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: And so, that's led to a separate discussion on what do we need to do for – do we need to do anything related to security findings on the commercial versions of analyzers specifically.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: That was the catalyst for this particular conversation because on container scanning,

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: we get a lot of findings related to Debian-based images that that project has not shipped a fix for or won't ship a fix for.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: So there is a separate thread that is going on here about what to do and can we do deviation requests in bulk for this class of findings.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: The TLDR is below, and there's a couple of options that are being brainstormed within this particular thread.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: So, I wanted – and I know I've said a lot of words and I didn't say it well, but I wanted to bring it here in case there was any questions or commentary.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: Nothing directly related to what you've just talked about, but sort of related.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: For FedRAMP, you're looking at any FIPS-related security issues that have been raised.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: How far are you going in terms of auditing to find anything that hasn't already been identified?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: There is, I'll link in another issue, a separate issue that has instructions from AppSec on what they would like us to do as far as setting up container scanning.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: And they have set up a project with a single configuration.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: that they're asking us to use.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: There is some debate as to how that project has been configured because it uses a combination of three container scanning tools rather than one.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: And so they've asked us to use that as a baseline for the FIPS images specifically.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: since they're UBI – or the UBI-specific images.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: They're equivalent in my mind, even though they're different meanings.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: So, TLDR, talk to APSIC.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: Got it.

conversation.text: So, in the hallway – so, from the development staff meeting, I copied and pasted the notes in there, but Ned is – the TLDR is, can folks – the request to me and my peers was, can folks check with their teams to see if the approvals are affecting them?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06

conversation.text: If they're looking in Rule 8 to see,

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: To find out the number of maintainers, that's the wrong place.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: The engineering projects page should list all the maintainers if you set up your team YAML entries correctly.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: I would have thought that was more than a single source of truth.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 08
conversation.text: Apparently not.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 08
conversation.text: So yeah.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: Yeah, I'm looking at the chart.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: I mean, I think on some of these projects, we just haven't filled it out.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: I'll give you, like, we have the API, the HubFuzz, we have one engineer that works on it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: So we haven't gone and added a maintainer there because they know who they are.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: So if we are trying to maintain that as a single source of truth, we need to just go through and scrub it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: Sorry, Seth, I'm reminded of this.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: I'm reminded of the Spider-Man meme with the two Spider-Men pointing at each other.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: Who's the reviewer?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: Who's the author?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: It's the same person.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: It's been a long day, so I'm a little punchy.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: But yes, that makes sense.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: So, Seth, are you saying you haven't added it to individual team members' YAML files in the handbook yet?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: Right.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: I believe for that one, there's just no entry for it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 07
conversation.text: I mean, we could.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: I think that should do it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: Yeah, well, it should.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: They shouldn't be using just roulette.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: They should be using that as a source of truth.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: And I think if you've listed maintainers, that should cover it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 05
conversation.text: A follow up question would be, does that cover the senior plus engineers must be a maintainer requirement or not?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: Thomas, you buried the, what do you call it, buried the lead?

conversation.speaker: Speaker 06
conversation.text: I took the read-only off your comment there, so you can announce it.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: Well, we're going to end with the best news of the day.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: That's all.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: But the maintainer requirement, yes, it does.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: I mean, because it's for Senior Plus, going back to that, is just maintaining one or more, I think, is the requirement for Member Berkeley.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: I was talking about the Olivier news.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: Yeah, I know.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: I was just making sure we were finished with the topic above.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: All right.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: And we're at time, so I will move on and take that as a prompt.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: Yeah, Olivier has popped back on Slack to announce that the newest edition of their family is here and happened over the weekend.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: So big, big congrats to his family for that.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 04
conversation.text: And we'll be hoping to celebrate him later when he returns to work.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 08
conversation.text: Cool.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 08
conversation.text: Thanks, everybody.

conversation.speaker: Speaker 08
conversation.text: Have a great day.
